subclusters.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Aging Immunological Theory
Immune Dysfunction and Immune Surveillance Decline Theory
Innate Immune Dysfunction and Toll-like Receptor Aging Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Aging Immunological Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on biphasic thymic involution phases and their impact on T cell output and immunosenescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Aging Immunological Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on progressive thymic atrophy reducing naive T cell output and peripheral T cell senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Aging Immunological Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes thymic involution causing naive T cell decline and accumulation of aged memory T cells.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Aging Immunological Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes thymus-pineal axis regulating thymic function and immune aging, linking neuroendocrine control.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Aging Immunological Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details thymic involution, altered T cell subsets, and chronic antigenic stress driving immunosenescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Aging Immunological Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related T cell subset changes predicting immune senescence and systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Aging Immunological Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explores replicative exhaustion of T cells due to antigenic stimulation and thymic output decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Aging Immunological Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes T cell replicative senescence and immune risk phenotype as drivers of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Aging Immunological Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes immunosenescence with T and B cell aging, naive cell loss, and memory cell accumulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Aging Immunological Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on chronic antigenic stress causing naive lymphocyte loss and B cell immunosenescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Aging Immunological Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details adaptive and innate immune changes with aging, including CMV-driven T cell alterations.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thymic Involution and T Cell Aging Immunological Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Classic immunologic theory highlighting immunosenescence, replicative senescence, and immune risk profiles.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune Dysfunction and Immune Surveillance Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes immune dysfunction and T cell helper/suppressor imbalance as causal in aging and lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune Dysfunction and Immune Surveillance Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on faulty immune surveillance, MHC gene roles, and autoimmune-like phenomena in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune Dysfunction and Immune Surveillance Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes immune remodeling, age-associated B cells, mitochondrial dysfunction, and autoimmunity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune Dysfunction and Immune Surveillance Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links hematopoietic stem/progenitor cell aging, DNA damage, and immune dysfunction in rheumatoid arthritis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune Dysfunction and Immune Surveillance Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details immunosenescence-driven loss of tolerance and vascular inflammation in age-related vasculitis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune Dysfunction and Immune Surveillance Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Connects immune decline and impaired tumor surveillance to increased cancer incidence with aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune Dysfunction and Immune Surveillance Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes molecular hallmarks of immunosenescence and tumor microenvironment remodeling in cancer.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune Dysfunction and Immune Surveillance Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes thymic involution as programmed aging clock and immune-mediated cell selection driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Innate Immune Dysfunction and Toll-like Receptor Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related impairment of macrophage TLR signaling causing ineffective pathogen clearance and inflammaging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Innate Immune Dysfunction and Toll-like Receptor Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows environmental adversity induces immune gene expression changes mimicking aging and chronic inflammation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Innate Immune Dysfunction and Toll-like Receptor Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Exercise-induced removal of senescent T cells and thymopoiesis rejuvenates immune system and delays immunosenescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Innate Immune Dysfunction and Toll-like Receptor Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Inflammation as an evo-devo remodeling tool linking environment, genetic adaptation, and chronic inflammatory diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Innate Immune Dysfunction and Toll-like Receptor Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Inflammatory/pathogen burden accumulates with age, driving immunosenescence and systemic aging including cardiac aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Innate Immune Dysfunction and Toll-like Receptor Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Chronic low-grade inflammation and NF-κB signaling interplay with oxidative stress to drive aging processes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Innate Immune Dysfunction and Toll-like Receptor Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Chronic proinflammatory state with cytokines like TNF-α and IL-6 causes muscle atrophy and functional decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Innate Immune Dysfunction and Toll-like Receptor Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: NF-κB pathway activation and SASP drive chronic inflammation and entropic aging via molecular damage accumulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Innate Immune Dysfunction and Toll-like Receptor Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: IL-6’s pleiotropic role in chronic inflammation modulates mitochondrial energetics and aging outcomes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Innate Immune Dysfunction and Toll-like Receptor Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Inflammation-induced epigenetic erosion in stem cells triggers ferroptosis, linking inflammation to stem cell aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Inflammation-Driven Hematopoietic Stem Cell Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Inflammation causes irreversible hematopoietic stem cell exhaustion and functional decline accelerating aging.
